definitions.definition: Any of various tropical and subtropical evergreen shrubs or trees chiefly of the Rhizophoraceae family that have aerial roots and grow in clumps in brackish intertidal coastal areas ; ( specifically ) any of various trees of the genus Rhizophora , especially the red mangrove ( Rhizophora mangle ).

subdefinitions.definition: A forest of such shrubs or trees.
Preceded by a descriptive word : any of various shrubs or trees of genera other than Rhizophora which resemble plants of this genus in appearance and habitat .
Synonym of mangal (“a tropical and subtropical coastal intertidal swampland ecosystem characterized by mangroves ( sense 1 ) or similar shrubs and trees”).

main_definition: Any of various tropical and subtropical evergreen shrubs or trees chiefly of the Rhizophoraceae family that have aerial roots and grow in clumps in brackish intertidal coastal areas ; ( specifically ) any of various trees of the genus Rhizophora , especially the red mangrove ( Rhizophora mangle ). [from early 17th c.]
